intro: Relhania pungens subsp. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf relhania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and coastal environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found growing on cliffs or in sandy soils, adapting well to harsh coastal conditions. The subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage and unique growth form.
